acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-hour EC50=30930microg/L(AQUIRE, 2003) of Crustacea (Water fleas).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Rat dermal LD50 = 1200mg/kg (IUCLID (2000), RTECS (2000), HSDB (2003)). Rabbit dermal LD50 = 1250mg/kg (IUCLID (2000), RTECS (2000), HSDB (2003)). The lower one (LD50=1200 mg/kg) was adopted, and it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on LC50 = 1900ppm (equivalent 8mg/L) which is obtained by having converted rat inhalation LC50 value (8hr, 950ppm) for 4 hours, it was classified as Category 3. In addition, the saturated concentration of this product is 1000ppm, and it is presumed that the inhalation test is done in the state of steam.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the value of LD50 = 848mg/kg calculated by the rat oral LD50 values : 1500, 720, 1000, 800 and 840mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) and 700, 1500 and 1300mg/kg (HSDB(2003)), the substance was classified as Category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (BOD: 63.4% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), and less bio-accumulative (log Kow=1.56 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is only the result of the Ames test negative in in vitro (IUCLID (2000)), and it cannot be classified because of insufficient data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 550 degC (ICSC (J), 1999), and even if it contacts the air of normal temperature, it does not ignite spontaneously.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The intended use is as solvent, and it is considered that there is no self-febrility, and was set to the outside of category.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since stimulus condition like the redness of a conjunctiva and conjunctiva dropsy is acknowledged as a result of the injections against eyes of rabbit (IUCLID (2000)), and there is the description that a human ocular is stimulated (ICSC (J), (1999), SITTIG (4th, 2002), and HSFS (2000)), it is set as Category 2A-2B. In addition, the detailed categorization from the acquired information is difficult.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since there was description that it stimulates to "Moderate (moderately)" as a result of the standard Draize's method for a rabbit (RTECS and (2000), HSDB (2003)) and the human skin is stimulated (ICSC (J), (1999), SITTIG (4th, 2002), HSFS (2000)), it was set as category 2.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is a report that there was no causing sensitivity (HSDB(2003)) as a result of doing a patch test to a volunteer, there is no other data, and data is insufficient and it cannot classify.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since there is description that disorder is occured on central nervous system and liver in the inhalation exposure experiment (steam) in a rat, exposure of the dosage which is equivalent to Category 2 with a guidance value (IUCLID(2000), and RTECS(2000)), it was classified into Category 2 (central nervous system, and liver).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there is description that it has influence of distraction, headache, nausea, vomiting, etc., in the document of Priority 2 as a result of human exposures (ICSC (J) (1999), SITTIG (4th, 2002), HSFS (2000)), and the symptom (a coma, limbs spasm, etc.) which derives in control of central nervous system by dose to rats and mice (dose course, amount of dose are unknown) was observed (HSDB (2003)), it was considered as Category 2 (central nervous system). Furthermore, since the respiratory tracts was stimulated (ICSC (J) (1999), HSFS (2000)), it was considered as Category 3 (respiratory irritation).
